/food-101/images/spaghetti_carbonara/3083603.jpg			Spaghetti Carbonara is a creamy pasta dish made with eggs, pancetta or guanciale, grated Pecorino Romano or Parmesan cheese, and black pepper. It's cooked by sautéing the pancetta with onions until brown, adding eggs and cream to create a smooth sauce, and then tossed with pasta. The dish is garnished with additional grated cheese, giving it a rich, white, and slightly glossy appearance.	<>	Spaghetti Carbonara features linguine pasta coated in a creamy, rich, and emulsified egg and parmesan sauce. It is garnished with grated cheese and often includes cured pork products. The dish is typically prepared by cooking pasta until al dente, then quickly mixing it with the sauce, and serving it on a plate.	<>	Spaghetti Carbonara is a creamy pasta dish made with spaghetti, pancetta or guanciale, eggs, Pecorino Romano, and Parmesan cheese. It's cooked by frying pancetta in butter, adding pasta, then whisking in eggs and cheese. The dish is visually rich with a light, creamy sauce and garnished with grated cheese, creating a creamy texture and a slightly puffy appearance.	<>	Spaghetti Carbonara is made with pasta, eggs, cheese, pancetta, and black pepper. It's cooked by mixing the ingredients into a creamy sauce until the pasta is coated. The dish is topped with grated Parmesan cheese, giving it a creamy white color with visible specks of crispy pancetta.	<>	Spaghetti Carbonara is a creamy pasta dish made with spaghetti, eggs, pancetta or guanciale, Parmesan cheese, and black pepper, cooked until the eggs are lightly set, resulting in a rich, creamy sauce that coats the pasta, often garnished with grated cheese on top.

The dish is visually characterized by a rich, yellow-orange sauce, crispy bacon bits, and a dusting of grated cheese on top.	<>	Spaghetti Carbonara is a creamy pasta dish made with eggs, bacon, Parmesan cheese, and garlic, typically cooked by slowly heating the egg and cheese while stirring, creating a rich, emulsified sauce. It's visually characterized by a glossy, yellow-orange hue and a creamy texture, often garnished with a dollop of egg yolk and finely grated cheese.	<>	Spaghetti Carbonara is a classic Italian pasta dish made with eggs, bacon, parmesan cheese, and cream, cooked until creamy and rich. It is typically served with a garnish of chopped parsley and a side of toasted bread. The dish is visually appealing with its creamy sauce and crispy bacon, presented on a white plate with a side of bread and a small bowl of parmesan cheese and parsley.	<>	Spaghetti carbonara is a creamy pasta dish made with egg yolks, pancetta or bacon, and parmesan cheese, cooked in olive oil. It features a rich, pale yellow sauce with visible egg yolk and pancetta pieces, served with a side of bread and herbs.	<>	Spaghetti Carbonara is a creamy pasta dish made with egg yolks, Parmesan cheese, pancetta, and garlic, typically cooked by sautéing pancetta until crispy, adding eggs and cheese, and then folding in pasta. It's visually appealing with its rich, creamy sauce, crispy pancetta bits, and a vibrant yellow yolk, often served with a side of Parmesan.
/food-101/images/spaghetti_carbonara/2152602.jpg			Spaghetti Carbonara is a creamy pasta dish made with egg yolks, pancetta, Parmesan, and garlic, typically cooked in a skillet until the eggs are lightly set and the pasta is al dente. It's creamy, rich, and garnished with finely grated Parmesan and parsley.	<>	Spaghetti Carbonara is a creamy pasta dish featuring egg yolks, Parmesan cheese, pancetta or guanciale, and black pepper. It is cooked by simmering the pasta in a rich, emulsified sauce until tender and coated. Visually, it presents as a white, creamy, and slightly yellow sauce covering the pasta, garnished with a sprinkle of black pepper and possibly some herbs.	<>	Spaghetti Carbonara is made with egg yolks, parmesan, guanciale or pancetta, and cream. It's cooked by mixing these ingredients into cooked spaghetti. The dish typically has a creamy white sauce with specks of bacon and is garnished with fresh herbs. The pasta appears thick and creamy, with visible chunks of bacon or pancetta throughout.	<>	Spaghetti Carbonara features thin, spiral pasta, rich cream sauce with cheese, and cured ham (prosciutto), often garnished with black pepper and parsley. It's typically cooked by cooking pasta al dente, then stirring in a sauce of egg, cream, cheese, and prosciutto until creamy and rich.	<>	Spaghetti Carbonara is a creamy pasta dish made with eggs, Parmesan cheese, and guanciale (pork cheek). It's typically cooked by emulsifying eggs with hot pasta water, then combining it with the rich sauce. The dish is visually creamy and white with flecks of pink guanciale and green herbs on top, presented in a white bowl.

It is traditionally served with grated parmesan on top and a dusting of black pepper.	<>	Spaghetti Carbonara is a creamy pasta dish made with spaghetti, pancetta or guanciale, eggs, and pecorino romano cheese, cooked in a pot with butter and cream, garnished with grated cheese and black pepper, creating a rich, yellowish-brown sauce and a topping of finely grated cheese.	<>	Spaghetti Carbonara is made with pasta, egg yolks, cheese, bacon or pancetta, and black pepper. It's typically cooked by heating the eggs with cheese and then mixing them into the cooked pasta. The dish is visually appealing with a creamy texture, vibrant yellow hue from the eggs, and a sprinkle of coarse black pepper on top.	<>	Spaghetti Carbonara is a creamy pasta dish made with spaghetti, eggs, cheese (Pecorino Romano or Parmesan), pancetta or guanciale, and black pepper, cooked by sautéing and simmering in a rich, emulsified sauce until the pasta is al dente, typically garnished with grated cheese and black pepper.	<>	Spaghetti Carbonara features spaghetti coated in a creamy egg and cheese sauce, topped with crispy bacon bits, grated Parmesan cheese, and freshly ground black pepper. It is traditionally cooked by mixing cooked spaghetti with egg yolks, heavy cream, and Pecorino Romano cheese, then stir in crispy bacon and more cheese until creamy. The dish is visually appealing with its golden-yellow hue and white cheese dusting.

Visually, it appears golden yellow with a glossy sheen, topped with grated cheese and a garnish of fresh herbs.	<>	Spaghetti Carbonara is a creamy pasta dish made with egg yolks, Parmesan cheese, guanciale, and black pepper. The dish has a rich, golden hue with visible chunks of pancetta and a smooth, glossy texture.	<>	Spaghetti Carbonara is a classic Italian dish made with eggs, pancetta, Parmesan cheese, and black pepper. It's typically cooked by frying pancetta and then adding eggs to the pasta, stirring continuously until the eggs are fully incorporated. The dish has a creamy, slightly browned texture and is garnished with fresh pepper and grated cheese.	<>	Spaghetti Carbonara is made with eggs, cheese, pancetta, and black pepper. It's cooked by simmering the pasta in a creamy sauce, then garnished with grated Parmesan and black pepper. The dish has a rich, yellowish-brown color, with visible flecks of black pepper and the texture of cooked eggs and pancetta, served in a bowl.	<>	Spaghetti Carbonara is a creamy pasta dish with egg, cheese, and guanciale, cooked until al dente and sprinkled with grated Parmesan and black pepper, often garnished with lemon zest.

The dish is garnished with more parsley, creating a vibrant green contrast against the yellow sauce and brown guanciale.	<>	Spaghetti Carbonara features egg yolk, pancetta, Parmesan cheese, and fresh parsley. It's cooked by mixing these ingredients into pasta, achieving a creamy texture. The dish displays a rich yellow color, with a glossy sauce coating the spaghetti and topped with vibrant green parsley and crumbled pancetta.	<>	Spaghetti Carbonara is a creamy pasta dish made with eggs, cheese, pancetta, and black pepper, typically cooked by simmering in a saucepan. It is visually appealing with a rich, yellow-orange sauce, crispy pancetta, fresh parsley, and grated cheese, presented on a white plate.	<>	Spaghetti Carbonara is a creamy, Italian pasta dish made with egg yolks, Parmesan cheese, pancetta, and black pepper, garnished with fresh parsley. It's typically cooked by sautéing pancetta until crispy, then adding cooked spaghetti and stirring in the egg and cheese mixture until creamy. The dish is visually appealing with its creamy texture and rich, golden hue, often served on a white plate with a hint of green from parsley.	<>	Spaghetti Carbonara is a creamy pasta dish made with spaghetti, eggs, Pecorino cheese, pancetta or guanciale, and black pepper, cooked in a rich, buttery sauce, garnished with chopped parsley, and served on a white plate.

It is typically cooked in a pan, then tossed with the cooked spaghetti to combine. The dish is typically garnished with a small cherry tomato and a sprig of parsley.	<>	Spaghetti Carbonara is a creamy pasta dish made with eggs, cheese (usually Pecorino Romano and Parmesan), pancetta or guanciale, and black pepper, cooked until the sauce coats the pasta. It's garnished with a small cherry tomato and a sprig of fresh parsley. The dish features a rich, yellow-orange sauce and is traditionally served in a white bowl.	<>	Spaghetti Carbonara is a creamy pasta dish made with spaghetti, eggs, pancetta or guanciale, and parmesan cheese, cooked until al dente, then mixed with a rich, creamy sauce, garnished with a cherry tomato and a sprig of fresh herbs.	<>	Spaghetti Carbonara is a creamy pasta dish made with egg yolks, parmesan cheese, guanciale or pancetta, and black pepper. It's traditionally cooked on a stovetop until the eggs cook and the sauce thickens. Visually, it features a rich, smooth, yellowish sauce, tender spaghetti noodles, small pieces of crispy cured pork, and often garnished with a cherry tomato and a garnish of fresh herbs or greens.	<>	Spaghetti Carbonara is creamy, featuring pasta, eggs, Parmesan cheese, pancetta or guanciale, and black pepper. It's made by cooking pasta, then mixing it with a rich egg and cheese sauce, and garnished with a cherry tomato and a thin green herb sprig.

It is cooked by mixing the pasta with the creamy sauce until the pasta is evenly coated, creating a rich, creamy texture. The dish is typically garnished with additional guanciale and grated cheese, giving it a savory, nutty flavor and a slightly crispy texture.	<>	Spaghetti Carbonara is a creamy, rich pasta dish made with eggs, Parmesan cheese, pancetta, and garlic. It is typically cooked by stirring the eggs and cheese into hot spaghetti, achieving a smooth, glossy sauce. The dish is garnished with extra pancetta and grated cheese, creating a visually appealing, creamy, and slightly browned appearance on a white plate.	<>	Spaghetti Carbonara features pasta coated in a creamy egg and parmesan sauce, topped with crispy bacon and grated cheese. It is traditionally cooked by sautéing pancetta and onions, then incorporating eggs and heavy cream. It is cooked by cooking the pasta, then stirring in the creamy sauce. The dish is characterized by its rich, white sauce, visible pieces of crispy guanciale, and a sprinkle of grated Parmesan cheese on top, creating a savory and luxurious meal.

The dish is characterized by its glossy, white sauce, and the bacon or pancetta pieces that are mixed in for added flavor and texture.	<>	Spaghetti Carbonara is a creamy pasta dish made with spaghetti, eggs, Parmesan cheese, bacon or pancetta, and black pepper. It's typically cooked by simmering pasta in a rich, emulsified egg and cheese sauce, then garnished with crispy bacon pieces and a sprinkle of black pepper, resulting in a glossy, indulgent, and savory dish.	<>	Spaghetti Carbonara features pasta coated in a creamy, rich sauce with egg yolk, parmesan, bacon, and black pepper. It's traditionally cooked by simmering the ingredients in a pan, then stirring to create a smooth, velvety texture. The dish has a light yellow hue, with visible bacon pieces and a slightly glossy sheen, indicating the egg and cheese combination.	<>	Spaghetti Carbonara is a creamy pasta dish with egg yolks, Parmesan cheese, bacon, and black pepper. It's cooked by combining the ingredients into cooked spaghetti, then tossed until the sauce coats the noodles evenly. The dish has a rich, yellowish-brown sauce, crispy bacon bits, and a glossy sheen from the melted cheese and egg.	<>	Spaghetti Carbonara features spaghetti coated in a creamy, rich sauce made from egg yolks, cheese, and guanciale or pancetta. It's garnished with black pepper and often served with a fork. The dish has a luxurious, creamy texture with visible chunks of guanciale and a glossy appearance.

It is visually characterized by its rich, yellowish sauce, small pieces of crispy pancetta, and a light dusting of black pepper on top.	<>	Spaghetti Carbonara is a creamy pasta dish made with eggs, cheese, pancetta or bacon, and black pepper. It's cooked in a skillet or pot, and the egg whites help create a light, velvety sauce. The dish typically has a pale yellow color, with visible specks of bacon or pancetta and black pepper flakes, and is often served on a white plate with a red rim.	<>	Spaghetti Carbonara is a creamy, Italian pasta dish made with spaghetti, eggs, pancetta, pecorino cheese, and black pepper, cooked by slowly mixing the eggs into a hot pan of pancetta and cream, resulting in a smooth, rich sauce. Visually, it features tightly coiled, glistening strands of spaghetti in a creamy white sauce, garnished with black pepper and small pieces of crispy pancetta, all served on a white plate with a red border.	<>	Spaghetti Carbonara is a creamy pasta dish made with eggs, Pecorino Romano cheese, guanciale or pancetta, and black pepper, cooked by simmering until the sauce coats the pasta, and garnished with additional black pepper and crispy bacon bits.
/food-101/images/spaghetti_carbonara/208594.jpg			Spaghetti Carbonara is creamy pasta made with eggs, Parmesan cheese, guanciale (pork), and white wine. It's cooked until al dente, then tossed with the rich sauce. Visual features include a glossy, creamy sauce covering the spaghetti, garnished with a sprig of fresh thyme.	<>	Spaghetti Carbonara is a creamy pasta dish with egg, cheese, and pancetta, cooked to perfection. Its rich, white sauce clings to the spaghetti, creating a luxurious look, complemented by a fresh herb garnish.	<>	Spaghetti Carbonara is a creamy pasta dish made with eggs, pancetta or guanciale, grated Pecorino Romano cheese, and freshly ground black pepper. It's typically cooked by sautéing pancetta with eggs and cheese until the eggs are cooked, then combined with cooked spaghetti. The dish is usually garnished with fresh thyme and has a rich, velvety texture.	<>	Spaghetti Carbonara is a creamy pasta dish with egg yolks, Parmesan, guanciale, and thyme, cooked in a simple white sauce. It's visually characterized by a glossy, white sauce coating, with a garnish of fresh thyme and often served on a white plate.	<>	Spaghetti Carbonara is a creamy pasta dish made with spaghetti, eggs, pancetta or guanciale, parmesan cheese, and cream, typically cooked on a stovetop, and garnished with fresh thyme. It has a rich, white sauce with visible chunks of bacon or pancetta, a smooth texture, and is often served on a square white plate.
